sect3.title: Configuration
sect3.para: This component is used for the graphical display of time-variant data. A random number of floating point data can be saved on the left and on the right y-axis for each time step. The current time is displayed on the x-axis. All axis types and descriptions can be configured, also the colors and types of the graphs displayed. The following colors are valid: yellow, orange, red, pink, magenta, cyan, yellow, green, lightgray, gray, black

The types of graphs can be displayed separately for the left and right part of the y-axis (typeLeft/typeRight). The table below lists all valid types. Valid types of graphs
Coding Type of diagram
0 XYLineAndShapeRenderer
1 XYBarRenderer
2 XYAreaRenderer
3 XYLineAndShapeRenderer
4 XYDotRenderer
5 XYDifferenceRenderer (Note: when using this type, at least two graphs have to displayed on the corresponding axis!)
6 XYStepRenderer
7 XYStepAreaRenderer
Since the valueLeft/valueRight are arrays, technically any number of graphs can be displayed. In practice, the runtime performance is negatively influenced by a growing number of graphs. Moreover, it has to be considered that the number of color shades (colorLeft/colorRight), the number of designations of the individual graphs (titleLeft/titleRight) and the number of values to be displayed (valueLeft/valueRight) have to correspond. For example, the designation of a right value for color or only a right title results in an error when two right graphs exist.

sect3.title: Behavior
sect3.para:
Each time the run() method is selected, the data given to TSPlot (valueLeft/valueRight) are dynamically inserted into the diagram and generate a graphic output according to the defined type (typeLeft/typeRight) and selected color (colorLeft/colorRight). The user can interact with TSPlot components anytime; the following options are available:
Zoom in: The top left corner of a selected area is selected in the diagram window by clicking the right or left mouse button, while holding the button the mouse is dragged to the bottom right corner and dropped at any end point.
Zoom out: The procedure is similar to that of zooming in, i.e. press and hold the mouse button from the bottom right to the top left, then drop.
Save current view in file: By single-clicking on the diagram window with the right mouse button the TSPlot menu opens; then select menu item "Save as..." and choose output file. The output is done in PNG format for the part of the diagram which is currently displayed.
Adjust display: By single-clicking on the diagram window with the right mouse button the TSPlot menu opens; select the menu item "Properties...". In the following dialog window various parameters for display of the diagram can be modified.
